trans-unit.source: Holds an <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationFixupCallback"></xref> delegate instance, plus the method's inputs; also serves as the parameter for the method.

While deserializing XML documents into .NET Framework objects, the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure dynamically instantiates fix-up methods that implement the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationFixupCallback> delegate; plus, it instantiates <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader.Fixup> class objects to store the fix-up methods along with their inputs.
The infrastructure does so for SOAP-encoded arrays whose data types map to .NET Framework reference types.
Then, as necessary, a fix-up method is called to fill in the objects in the array.

In addition, during initialization, the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure dynamically generates and compiles a temporary class for deserialization derived from the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader> class.

During this process, the infrastructure generates <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationFixupCallback> properties plus <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader.Fixup> class objects for SOAP-encoded, multireferenced XML data.
The methods are then invoked during deserialization.
Do not directly create an instance of the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationFixupCallback> or <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader.Fixup> class.
SOAP encoding is described in Section 5 of the SOAP 1.1 specification.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader.Fixup"></xref> class.
Do not directly create an instance of the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader.Fixup> class or the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationFixupCallback> delegate.
The object that contains other objects whose values get filled in by the callback implementation.
A method that instantiates the <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationFixupCallback"></xref> delegate.
The size of the string array obtained through the <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader.Fixup.Ids"></xref> property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader.Fixup"></xref> class.
Do not directly instantiate the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader.Fixup> class or the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationFixupCallback> delegate.
The object that contains other objects whose values get filled in by the callback implementation.
A method that instantiates the <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationFixupCallback"></xref> delegate.
The string array obtained through the <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader.Fixup.Ids"></xref> property.
Gets the callback method that creates an instance of the <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationFixupCallback"></xref> delegate.
The callback method that creates an instance of the <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationFixupCallback"></xref> delegate.

Gets or sets an array of keys for the objects that belong to the <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader.Fixup.Source"></xref> property whose values get filled in by the callback implementation.
The objects can be a SOAP-encoded array or items that belong to a Web service method that maps to a SOAP-encoded message.
The array of keys.
Gets or sets the object that contains other objects whose values get filled in by the callback implementation.
The object to fix can be one of the following:
An array whose items the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationFixupCallback> delegate implementation fills in.
A mapping between a Web service method and a SOAP message that can be defined in a Web Services Description Language (WSDL) document.
The members of the mapping, such as method parameters, get filled in by the callback method.
The source containing objects with values to fill.
